required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of AZD1656 in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) Patients Treated With Metformin and Sulfonylurea
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase I Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AZD1656 Compared to Placebo in T2DM Patients Treated With Metformin and Sulfonylurea

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of AZD1656 in T2DM patients treated with metformin and sulfonylurea.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety variables (AE, BP, pulse, plasma glucose, laboratory variables, weight and ECG
primary_outcome.time_frame: AE will be collected from the time for randomisation until follow-up visit. Safety variables and vital signs will be measured at the pre-entry, during study days -2 to 10 and at the follow-up visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic variables: (Area under the plasma concentration vs. time curve (AUC), maximum plasma concentration (Cmax), time to reach maximum plasma concentration (tmax), terminal elimination half-life (t½) and apparent oral clearance (CL/F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples for analysis of plasma concentrations of AZD1656 will be collected on study days 6 and 9. The samples for analysis of glipizide will be collected on study days -1 and 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic variables: 24 h plasma glucose, Insulin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples for 24-hour plasma glucose and insulin will be collected on study days -1, 6 and 9.

intervention.description: Dose titration of oral suspension of AZD165 during 3 days to a tolerable dose given twice daily. Subjects will thereafter be treated with this dose twice daily for another 6 days
Dose titration of oral suspension of placebo during 3 days given twice daily. Subjects will thereafter be for another 6 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or females of non-childbearing potential
- Patients treated with a combination of Metformin and SU (glyburide, glimepiride, glibenclamide, glipizide or gliclazide) in stable doses for at least 2 months prior to enrolment visit
- Patients should have FPG in the range of 6,0 to 14 mmol/L (108 to 250 mg/dL) at enrolment and on the morning of randomisation
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of ischemic heart disease, symptomatic heart failure, stroke, transitory ischemic attack or symptomatic peripheral vascular disease
- Impaired renal function in terms of GFR<60 ml/min
- Use of insulin, glitazones, gemfibrozil, warfarin, amiodarone within 3 months prior to enrolment (screening) and use of potent CYP450 inhibitors, e.g., ketoconazole within 14 days before randomisation
